channel.title: Recommended Sandbox style games?
channel.description: For some reason I simply love roving around a large environment and do whatever the hell I want... probably stemmed from playing Crazy Taxi as a kid. I haven't played much (or any) of those games nowadays... any recommendations for any good sandbox style titles (for the PC) out there? And knowing this forum I might as well start a discussion on sandbox style games in general. Any favorites I can try out?

item.title: Recommended Sandbox style games?
item.dc:creator: Bmsmg
item.description:
Holy shit Just Cause 2 is freaking awesome…
Strongly recommend

Read full topic

item.title: Recommended Sandbox style games?
item.dc:creator: ravmahov
item.description:
eternalness:

Call Of Pripyat is better than modded Shadow of Chernobyl.

What can I say? I love both games, Shadow of Chernobyl and Call of Pripyat have some gameplay differences which are causing that they can’t be compared. Shadow of Chernobyl have much more maps, but smaller I think, too much cash you can’t spent, weapons and suits can’t be fixed, but still there are so many of them on map that this is not problem, enemies can’t use grenades, caches need to be unlocked to find something in them. CoP has 3 big maps, weapon/stuff repairing and upgrading, invisible artifacts and detectors for them, “blowouts” and new AI for every monster plus 2 new of these, caches are just item groups put on map from beginning, so next time you will play you can get everything on start. So, both games are worth ending them at least one time. sry for eng at the end

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

I looked it up. Unless you’re talking about the “R* Collection”, the “GTA Classics” collection does not have the “whole GTA series.” Just III, VC, and SA, and two other games that no one gives a shit about. It’s missing IV. And it’s $30.

Still, that’s a hell of a deal and no one should pass it up!

https://store.steampowered.com/sub/1353/
Definitely getting this soon regardless that my computer can’t play GTAIV.

the “GTA Classics” collection does not have the “whole GTA series.” Just III, VC, and SA, and two other games…

I really see nothing wrong with that. GTA IV is not as memorable or fun as VC, SA and III. The first two are actually alot of fun to play.

item.title: Recommended Sandbox style games?
item.dc:creator: Bmsmg
item.description:
Prototype is the best sandbox game. Period. It… It can’t be described.
Next to that I would have to recommend Fallout 3, one of my favorite games Especially if you’re into modding, which ,being on this forum, I imagine you are.

EDIT:
Crysis isn’t a sandbox game. I don’t know why people think it is. It’s not even close-- we’re talking invisible walls, Unkillable sharks, unchangeable objectives, no way to upgrade/improve your character…
The closest it gets is real-time weapon modification. Don’t believe them, the sprint function on the H.E.V. suit is more modular than the nanosuit.

Read full topic

Dust:

The whole GTA series pack is around £16 or something. Best deal ever.

Still, that’s a hell of a deal and no one should pass it up!

JohnKiller118:

Quoted, enlarged font, and changed the font to look more intimidating, for the fucking truth!
It’s $10 on Steam, so you have absolutely no excuse not to own this masterpiece.

The whole GTA series pack is around £16 or something. Best deal ever.

In response to CharChar, the main character in San Andreas was actually much better than you seem to be saying. He was not just spewing out black slang all over the place, he was actually a dead-on kind of guy.

item.title: Recommended Sandbox style games?
item.dc:creator: Nightblade
item.description:
Hello all! I’m new to your forum (first post) and would just like to say how awesome the Black Mesa conversion is!
It is so awesome.

Anywhooose, to answer Combine’s question, I have only come across one free form sandbox game that I would thoroughly recommend and that game is Mount&Blade.

Developed by the independent studio TaleWorlds and published by Paradox Interactive, the game itself is a medieval emulator (which is a gross oversimplification) in which you do basically whatever you want. Besides having a slew of positive reviews the game is also supported by a very active modding community.

I’ve been a member of their forum for a few years now and a player since the early beta days, and I can vouch for both the stock of the community and the attention the developers pay to their fans.

I’d advise you try the demo first in case it is too free form for your taste.
Also I’d advise you to consider holding off your purchase until the 30th of March, the release date of Mount&Blade: Warband which is a stand alone multiplayer expansion to the original.

You can purchase both from the TaleWorlds site (please do!) although Warband will only be available from the 30th of March.
Both titles are also available for purchase on Steam.

If you join the forum, tell them Nightblade±- sent ya.
I hope to do battle with you in the wilds of Calradia soon!

Read full topic
